xPower.BodyCopy:
Newly Admitted

To have a smooth advancement through the RN to BSN program once you are accepted, we suggest you do the following:

  • Mail the Department of Nursing your properly completed Acceptance Form. Once received, your major code will be changed to Bachelor of Science in Nursing.
  • Accept your placement with Brigham Young Univeristy - Idaho.
  • Create your BYU-Idaho login and password (if you haven't already) at www.byui.edu/netid.

More Newly Admitted Information

Clinicals

On campus RN to BSN students, and online students using facilities in Rexburg or Idaho Falls, will arrange clinical positions through the instructors in one of the first class meetings.

For RN to BSN students NOT using facilities in Rexburg or Idaho Falls to successfully secure a clinical position in a timely manner please:

  • Complete clinical hours that involve direct patient contact in a unit other than where you work
  • Arrange clinical rotations early (may need to be as early as one semester before needed)
  • Realize some hospitals prefer three months notice
  • Finalize arrangements at least three weeks before the semester starts

More Clinical Information

Courses Sequences

Students who follow a specific completion plan will attain their degree in the least amount of time. In order to provide flexibility, the plan is divided into Nursing cohorts and Baccalaureate Degree requirements as follows:

  • The 3- or 6-Semester Cohort of Core Nursing Courses
  • The Baccalaureate Degree Completion Plan (B.D.C.P.) including Foundations (G.E.) Courses
